story.storybody:
Peaches are in season! They're pretty, sweet and at their juiciest during summers. You can enjoy slices of this fruit any time you like. But there's something about an easy peachy cocktail that helps you unwind after a hard day at work. Given the rising heat of the summer, nothing feels better than indulging in a cold cocktail.

Also read: 12 cocktails and mocktails you must try this summer

Here are 3 easy peachy cocktail recipes you can try at home:

Peach sangria
This wine-based drink comes from Spain and Portugal, and usually has a splash of brandy in it too. But the main flavours come from the wine mixed with chopped fruits and fruit juice. Just take chopped or sliced peaches in a large jar and crush them a bit to release the juices. Add a teaspoon of brandy, peach juice or liqueur, and castor sugar.

{mosimage} Now add the white or red wine, and stir the cocktail. Pour it into wine glasses and take a sip. This one is fruity thanks to the wine and the peaches, but the brandy adds a strong under-taste that you'll relish with the juicy peaches.

Peach and rosemary vodka
This cocktail is a heady mix of sweet, strong and herb flavours. Take 3 peaches, halve them and blend them. Add one teaspoon lime juice, one teaspoon honey, 1 cup soda or Sprite and 3 cups of vodka. Mix the cocktail and top with rosemary sprigs and peach slices.

{mosimage} The blended peaches make sure that the fruity taste mixes well with the vodka, and the rosemary adds a hint of savoury flavour that you'll enjoy.

Also read: 5 amazing mango recipes from a chef, to make your summer more delicious

Peach whisky
Whisky, whether neat or in a cocktail, is for connoisseurs who don't wince at its strong taste. This cocktail is a smashing drink all whisky-lovers will enjoy. You will need to mix peach slices with one cup peach syrup, 2 cups whisky and 2 teaspoons lemon juice.

{mosimage} Pour this drink in glasses of your choice and take a sip of a strong cocktail. You can also add a few more peach slices and mint leaves to freshen up this cocktail.

These three cocktails are so easy to make that you can also throw in the ingredients just before an impromptu evening or lunch. They're refreshing and celebrate one of the best fruits of the season. It's the perfect way of enjoying the peaches and alcohol at the same time. If you haven't tried these peachy cocktails ever, you must soon.
